intro: Galium murale var. balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
